byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. reported from Fort Benning, and Helene Cooper from Washington.
byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and HELENE COOPER

abstract: Graduation of First Lt Shaye Haver and Capt Kristen Griest from Army's elite Ranger School is milestone moment in history of integrating women in military; is bound to have effect on what military positions should be open to women and which, if any, should stay closed.
lead_paragraph: Two Army Ranger graduates are set to break new ground in the military as the Pentagon prepares to decide which combat positions should be opened to women.

headline.main: 2 Graduating Rangers, Aware of Their Burden
headline.print_headline: 2 Graduating Rangers, Aware of Their Burden

snippet: Two Army Ranger graduates are set to break new ground in the military as the Pentagon prepares to decide which combat positions should be opened to women.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
